Adventure.API
Interface GameActor

All Superinterfaces:
GameObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
Actor
public interface GameActor
extends GameObject

This interface is used to represent any non-player characters within the game that can have conversations and inventories of their own. GameActors also have the ability to move from location to location.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Firmy

Method Detail

move

void move(java.lang.String direction)
This method is used to move this game actor through the exit that is in their current location that is in the direction specified.

Parameters:
direction - This is a String that represents the direction of the exit to use.

hasItem

boolean hasItem(java.lang.String itemName)
This method is used to determine if this GameActor has a GameItem in their inventory that has the specified name.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the item to check for.
Returns:
True if the item is in this GameActor's inventory, false otherwise.

item

GameItem item(java.lang.String itemName)
This method is used to retrieve a GameItem from this GameActor's inventory that has the name specified name.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the item to retrieve.
Returns:
The GameItem with the name specified or null if it is not found.

pickUpItem

void pickUpItem(java.lang.String itemName)
This method will get a GameItem from this GameActor's location and add it to their inventory.

Parameters:
itemName - The name of the item to pick up.

dropItem

void dropItem(java.lang.String itemName)
This method is used to take a GameItem from this GameActor's inventory an place back into their locations item list.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the item to drop.

giveItem

void giveItem(java.lang.String itemName)
This overload of the giveItem() method is used to give a GameItem in this GameActor's inventory to the Player.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the GameItem to give to the Player.

giveItem

void giveItem(java.lang.String itemName,
              GameActor actor)
This overload of the giveItem() method is used to give a GameItem in this GameActor's inventory to another GameActor.

Parameters:
itemName - The String name of the GameItem to give to the GameActor.
actor - The GameActor that the item is given to.

location

GameLocation location()
This is a getter method that is used to get this GameActor's current location.

Returns:
This method will return this GameActor's current GameLocation.

previousLocation

GameLocation previousLocation()
This is a getter method that is used to get this GameActor's last location.

Returns:
This method will return this GameActor's most recent GameLocation.

location

void location(GameLocation newLocation)
This setter method will update this GameActor's location to the new GameLocation that is specified.

Parameters:
newLocation - The new GameLocation to set as this GameActors current location.

hidden

boolean hidden()
This method will check whether this GameActor is currently hidden.

Returns:
True if this GameActor is hidden, false otherwise.

hidden

void hidden(boolean isHidden)
This setter method is used to update the hidden status of this GameActor.

Parameters:
isHidden - This is the boolean value to set the hidden status to.

meetPlayer

void meetPlayer()
This method will set the hasMetPlayer status for this GameActor to true.

forgetMeetingPlayer

void forgetMeetingPlayer()
This method will set the hasMetPlayer status for this GameActor to false.

initiateDialog

void initiateDialog()
This method is used to call the initiate method for this GameActor's initial GameDialog.

initialDialog

void initialDialog(GameDialog newInitialDialog)
This setter method is used to designate the initial GameDialog that is loaded when this GameActor has a conversation with the Player.

Parameters:
newInitialDialog - The GameDialog that is set as the initial one for conversations.

initialDialog

GameDialog initialDialog()
This getter method is used to retrieve this character's initial dialog for conversations.

Returns:
The GameDialog that represents this character's initial dialog.

hasMetPlayer

boolean hasMetPlayer()
This will determine if this GameActor has had it's status marked as having previously met the Player. This will be true automatically once the player has first spoken to this GameActor.

Returns:
True if the GameActor has met the player, False otherwise.
